description:
Works to trees in rear courtyard. 

 Works:  T1 Plane     Crown thin 35% throughout entire crown,                      cut back to allow clearance of 3m. from                      building, deadwood. 

         T2 Plane     Crown lift 6m., crown thin 35%                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T3 Plane     Crown lift 6m., crown thin 35%                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T4 Maple     Fell. 

         T5 Sycamore  Crown lift 5m., crown thin by 35%                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T6 Cherry    Fell. 

         T7 Holly     Fell. 

         T8 Cherry    Fell. 

         T9 Lime      Fell. 

         T10 Lime     Crown lift 7m., crown thin 35% - 40%,                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T11 Plane    Crown lift 7m., crown thin 35% - 40%,                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T12 Plane    Crown lift 7m., crown thin 35% - 40%,                      throughout entire crown, deadwood. 

         T13 Laburnum Fell. 

         T14 Plane    Fell. 

         T15 Maple.   Fell.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Within 12 calendar months of the removal of the tree a replacement tree shall be planted of an appropriate species and size agreed with the Local Planning Authority and in an agreed position to British Standard 4428: 1969 'General Landscape Operations'. 

 REASON: To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
